alert.note: Alert for Mecklenburg (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 28 at 6:57AM EST until January 29 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Piedmont North Carolina including Cabarrus and Mecklenburg Counties. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 655 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Huntersville, Kannapolis, Northeast Charlotte, West Concord, Cornelius, Davidson, Harrisburg, Coddle Creek Reservoir, Charlotte Motor Speedway, University City, Lake Norman and Croft. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
